title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {RegToMeanExample: Visualisation Regression to the Mean},   author = {Andre Meichtry},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0,  https://mcdr65.github.io/RegToMeanExample/},   url = {https://github.com/mcdr65/RegToMeanExample}, }

title: Visualisation Regression to the Mean
text: can install development version RegToMeanExample GitHub :

title: Visualisation Regression to the Mean
text: can load package play main () function:
code: library(RegToMeanExample) args(DBP.RTM) #> function (mu = 90, sigma = 8, r = 0.76, n = 1000, limit = 95,  #>     TrueChange = 0, show.plot = TRUE, show.out = FALSE)  #> NULL DBP.RTM()

title: Regression to the mean — DBP.RTM
code: DBP.RTM(   mu = 90,   sigma = 8,   r = 0.76,   n = 1000,   limit = 95,   TrueChange = 0,   show.plot = TRUE,   show.out = FALSE )

title: Regression to the mean — DBP.RTM
text: mu mean DBP baseline sigma standard deviation baseline follow-r pre-post correlation n sample size limit Limit hypertension TrueChange True Change Baseline. Default zero. show.plot Add plot, default=TRUE show.print results, default=FALSE

title: Regression to the mean — DBP.RTM
text: list plot showing equality line linear regression slope observations plot showing extreme subjects regression mean list summary - Summary statistics observations summary II - Summary statistics extreme cases (hypertension) correlation Pre-Post correlation intraclass correlation t-test t-test extreme model Coefs simple linear regression (, "fixing" baseline), equals correlation coefficient standardized data fraction regression mean, RTM, equals (1-rho) dataI observations dataII extreme cases

title: Regression to the mean — DBP.RTM
text: Senn, S. (2009) Three things every medical writer know statistics. Write Stuff, 18 (3). pp. 159-162. ISSN 1854-8466

title: Regression to the mean — DBP.RTM
code: ##Assume a true change of -10 (on diastolic blood presssure) DBP.RTM(TrueChange=-10)
